alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cocke (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 7:13AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount, Cocke, Knox, Loudon, McMinn, Monroe and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Knoxville, Maryville, Sevierville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, Niota, Philadelphia, Pittman Center and Townsend. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
